description: A photosensitive Light Dependent Resistor (LDR) module with a digital output and adjustable sensitivity via an onboard potentiometer. It detects ambient light intensity and provides an LED indicator when the light exceeds a threshold.
application_examples: Light level monitoring in environmental sensors
Ambient light detection for robotics and automation

specifications.sensor_type: Light Dependent Resistor (LDR) with digital output

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect VCC to +3 to +5 Vdc, GND to ground, and Digital Out to a microcontroller input pin. The onboard LED will turn on when ambient light exceeds the threshold.

example_code.explaination: Reads the digital output of the LDR module. A LOW value indicates light is detected, while HIGH means no light. The code prints the status to the serial monitor.

source_document: Handson Technology User Guide for Ambient Light Sensor Module
